DataElement.preferredName: Saliva Specimen Resting Flow pH Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The watery fluid made by mucous glands in the mouth. It moistens food to aid in digestion. A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis. Freedom from activity. The motion characteristic of fluids and gases; the amount of fluid that flows in a given time, e.g. through an body organ or part, expressed as volume per unit of time (called also flow rate). The logarithm of the reciprocal of hydrogen-ion concentration in gram atoms per lite, providing a measure, on a scale from 0 to 14, of the acidity or alkalinity of a solution where less than 7 is acidic, greater than 7 is basic, and 7 is neutral. A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (suh-LIE-vuh) The watery fluid made by mucous glands in the mouth. It moistens food to aid in digestion.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: The watery fluid in the mouth made by the salivary glands. Saliva moistens food to help digestion and it helps protect the mouth against infections.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Freedom from activity.:The motion characteristic of fluids and gases; the amount of fluid that flows in a given time, e.g. through an body organ or part, expressed as volume per unit of time (called also flow rate).:The logarithm of the reciprocal of hydrogen-ion concentration in gram atoms per lite, providing a measure, on a scale from 0 to 14, of the acidity or alkalinity of a solution where less than 7 is acidic, greater than 7 is basic, and 7 is neutral.

Concepts.definition: The continuous movement characteristic of a liquid or gas.

Quantity of dimension one used to express on a scale from 0 to 14 the amount-of-substance concentration of hydrogen ion of dilute aqueous solution, calculated as the logarithm of the reciprocal of hydrogen-ion concentration in gram atoms per liter.
